column3: Concept ACK. Could be interesting to disable these settings and see which tests require them.
utACK fa31ca0c22b35beaceaf131b8f598280abdfd58d.\n\n@Empact: Why should any tests "require" these settings at all?  They just make sure the tests enforce more things, no?

utACK fa31ca0\n\n@domob1812 I'm not that familiar with the checks, e.g. wrt to whether they have any side-effects, so I was curious to explore the counterfactual - if the checks are explicitly active now, and removing the explicit activation leaves them active by default, what happens if the default changes? Ran the affected tests with regtest `fDefaultConsistencyChecks = false`, and each passed
